quotes.quote: Healthy body image is not something that you're going to learn from fashion magazines.
If you ask men about their body image, they will tell you they look better than they do. And if you ask a woman, she'll tell you she looks worse.
Black women don't have the same body image problems as white women. They are proud of their bodies.
It's incredibly difficult to keep a healthy body image in this business.
To lose confidence in one's body is to lose confidence in oneself.
Each individual woman's body demands to be accepted on its own terms.
The sexiest part of the body is the eyes. That's what I believe.
What no woman or man needs is anyone telling them they are 'too fat' or 'too skinny.' That just adds to the many stereotypes out there about a person's weight.
I try not to be neurotic; I try to create and present healthy body image.
To keep the body in good health is a duty... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
A figure with curves always offers a lot of interesting angles.
The human body is the best picture of the human soul.
I've long struggled with my body image and have worked hard to achieve a healthy weight.
For a woman, body image is always a palpable thing. Weirdly, for me, the only time I don't care is when I'm in character.
Do something every day that is loving toward your body and gives you the opportunity to enjoy the sensations of your body.
Any body type is beautiful. It's all about loving what you got and rocking it.
The body is meant to be seen, not all covered up.
I'm not ashamed of what I am and that I have curves and that I'm thick. I like my body.
Don't change your body to get respect from society. Instead let's change society to respect our bodies.
The body is a sacred garment.
God gave me a great body and it's my duty to take care of my physical temple.
I'd rather be overweight and curvy than super thin with no curves. I'm proud of my body.
You are imperfect, permanently and inevitably flawed. And you are beautiful.
I don't use my body to seduce, no. I just stand there.
Our own physical body possesses a wisdom which we who inhabit the body lack. We give it orders which make no sense.
The human body is a machine which winds its own springs.
Our body is a machine for living. It is organized for that, it is its nature. Let life go on in it unhindered and let it defend itself.
Each body has its art...
The body says what words cannot.
Bottom line, your body is a temple, and you have to treat it that way. That's how God designed it.
